availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry B. Gifford (Pendleton County, Kentucky, farm worker and soldier)

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, farm worker and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Joshua Gifford and Elenor Gifford. Farm worker in Pendleton County in 1860. Private in the 5th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (C.S.A.) from September 10, 1862, to September 27, 1862. Corporal in the 5th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (C.S.A.) from September 27, 1862, to December 1862.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, p. 246.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky: Confederate Kentucky Volunteers War 1861-65, vol. 1 (Frankfort: Legislature of Kentucky, 1915), 270-271.
